metadata.title: CVE-2021-40732 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
XMP Toolkit version 2020.1 (and earlier) is affected by a null pointerdereference vulnerability that could result in leaking data from certainmemory locations and causing a local denial of service in the context ofthe current user. User interaction is required to exploit thisvulnerability in that the victim will need to open a specially crafted MXFfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exempi - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
libexempi8 - 2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exempi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.1-1ubuntu0.1').
